title.narrative: CROSS-SECTORAL COSTS

description.narrative: Operational support for delivery of programme results, which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Environmental Sustainability, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme effectiveness
Other General Services other general services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Operational support for delivery of programme results

description.narrative: UNICEF analytical and cross-sectoral efforts in 2020 contributed to the update of the UN CCA, mapping of vulnerable groups in the COVID-19 impact analysis, UNESCAP leaving no one behind analysis and drafting of a number of joint proposals on Digital Health, Digital Education and Disability, which provided a body of evidence for programme planning and COVID-19 response in Turkmenistan | Status:Met | As-of Date:26/01/2021

title.narrative: Support to country's COVID preparedness plan as part of the joint UN endeavour(68124)

baseline.value: No preparedness plan and actions at the beginning of the year.

target.value: 2020:UNICEF contributes to the development of Turkmenistan

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF contributed to the development of socio-economic response plan and country programme response plan to acute infectious diseases

title.narrative: Support to country's COVID preparedness plan as part of the joint UN endeavour(68124)

baseline.value: No preparedness plan and actions at the beginning of the year.

target.value: 2020:UNICEF contributes to the development of Turkmenistan

actual.value: 2020:UNICEF contributed to the development of socio-economic response plan and country programme response plan to acute infectious diseases

title.narrative: Availability of a national ECD policy or implementation plan for scale-up

baseline.value: The ECD Strategy for 2020-2025 was adopted in Dec 2019. Action Plan and M&E framework to support effective implementation are not in place although there are references to selected SDG indicators.

target.value: 2020:An Action Plan for the ECD Strategy, which includes specific activities with timelines, monitoring systems and performance indicators and clearer coordination mechanisms is available.

actual.value: 2020:ECD Action Plan 2020-2025, and M&E Framework was completed

title.narrative: Status of CO's emergency preparedness capacity(67662)

baseline.value: The last Simulation exercise was conducted in 2016; The last EPP update was done in Sep 2019.

target.value: 2020:EPR workshop and Simulation Exercise are conducted involving all staff with the support of the RO; The EPP update is done by the end of Mar and Oct; The 2020 Office Risk registry is updated and aligne

actual.value: 2020:Workshop was conducted and EPP update made
